States by First Letter

Letter A

  • Alabama (AL) - Capital: Montgomery
  • Alaska (AK) - Capital: Juneau
  • Arizona (AZ) - Capital: Phoenix
  • Arkansas (AR) - Capital: Little Rock

Letter C

  • California (CA) - Capital: Sacramento
  • Colorado (CO) - Capital: Denver
  • Connecticut (CT) - Capital: Hartford

Letter D

  • Delaware (DE) - Capital: Dover

Letter F

  • Florida (FL) - Capital: Tallahassee

Letter G

  • Georgia (GA) - Capital: Atlanta

Letter H

  • Hawaii (HI) - Capital: Honolulu

Letter I

  • Idaho (ID) - Capital: Boise
  • Illinois (IL) - Capital: Springfield
  • Indiana (IN) - Capital: Indianapolis
  • Iowa (IA) - Capital: Des Moines

Letter K

  • Kansas (KS) - Capital: Topeka
  • Kentucky (KY) - Capital: Frankfort

Letter L

  • Louisiana (LA) - Capital: Baton Rouge

Letter M

  • Maine (ME) - Capital: Augusta
  • Maryland (MD) - Capital: Annapolis
  • Massachusetts (MA) - Capital: Boston
  • Michigan (MI) - Capital: Lansing
  • Minnesota (MN) - Capital: Saint Paul
  • Mississippi (MS) - Capital: Jackson

  • Montana (MT) - Capital: Helena

Letter N

  • Nebraska (NE) - Capital: Lincoln
  • Nevada (NV) - Capital: Carson City

  • North Dakota (ND) - Capital: Bismarck

  • Ohio (OH) - Capital: Columbus
  • Oklahoma (OK) - Capital: Oklahoma City
  • Oregon (OR) - Capital: Salem

Letter P

  • Pennsylvania (PA) - Capital: Harrisburg

Letter R

  • Rhode Island (RI) - Capital: Providence

Letter S

  • South Dakota (SD) - Capital: Pierre

  • Tennessee (TN) - Capital: Nashville

  • Wisconsin (WI) - Capital: Madison
